subject: Public Speaking
title: MLK's Letter from Birmingham Jail
description: A short lesson to help you apply MLK's Letter from Birmingham Jail.

hook.text: In 1963, Martin Luther King Jr. was jailed for protesting. He wrote his reply on newspaper margins and toilet paper.

buildup.text: White clergy had called his protests unwise and untimely. King's letter dismantled their argument piece by piece.

discovery.text: He argued that injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. Waiting for the right time meant waiting forever.

twist.text: The letter was technically private correspondence, but it was published and became more influential than most speeches.

climax.text: King proved that moral clarity doesn't need a podium. A jail cell and a pen can be enough.

punchline.text: The most powerful room is sometimes a cell.

quiz.question: On what did MLK write his Letter from Birmingham Jail?
